abstract: Profile of Craig W Anderson, one of four Navy seamen who famously deserted from aircraft carrier Intrepid as act of protest during Vietnam War; Anderson, who is now writing memoir and hopes to rally new generation of antiwar activists, is featured in small exhibit aboard his old ship, which now serves as museum.

headline.print_headline: A Vietnam-Era Deserter Hopes to Rally a New Antiwar Generation
headline.main: After Decades Out of View, Navy Deserter Hopes to Rally a New Antiwar Generation

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Nearly 50 years after his desertion in protest of the Vietnam War, Craig W. Anderson of the “Intrepid Four” is cautioning against current military campaigns....
lead_paragraph: Nearly 50 years after his desertion in protest of the Vietnam War, Craig W. Anderson of the “Intrepid Four” is cautioning against current military campaigns.
